Reasoning: **Rerolling the Shop: A Calculated Gamble**

Okay, let's break this down. Ante 4, Round 10. The ultimate goal here is Boss Blind, which requires 20,000 chips. I have $36, but I keep remembering that the current state says $39... let's stick with $36 for now, for the sake of caution. My Joker lineup is solid: Gros Michel is great for Mult, the Egg is a cash cow, Droll Joker offers Mult and xMult scaling, Perkeo is a utility, and Blue Joker adds chips.

The shop is... underwhelming. Space Joker is too risky, Fortune Teller is only +11 and I've got Gros Michel at +15. No need to buy cards. Magic Trick is not optimal. The Reroll Surplus voucher means rerolling the shop costs only $3.

I need to balance money for interest (I'll cap at $25 to earn $5), with searching for powerful Jokers. I also want to keep the Egg in the mix; it's currently worth $28. It's a gold mine.

Perkeo is going to make a negative copy of one of "The Moon" cards, which is great for suit consistency. I don't need to buy anything specifically for Perkeo to have this effect.

The current shop options are weak, but with Clearance Sale, a reroll is a viable option to find better Jokers or Planets (especially Jupiter).

Do I reroll or go to round select? Reroll cost is $3 and money is $36, so I can afford a few rerolls while staying above $25. Finding a better scaling joker or Jupiter is worth it.

First, let's rearrange my jokers to make sure the order is optimal: Chips (Blue Joker) -> +Mult (Gros Michel, Droll) -> xMult (Droll, Polychrome). Gros Michel (15 Mult), Droll Joker (+10, x1.5, x1.5). This is correct.

I'm thinking about the shop. I could check the Standard Pack, but "The Moon" handles suits. I'll take a single reroll to look for a Jupiter or a better Joker. I can afford it.

So, I reroll. Current money $36 to $33. Still above $25 interest cap.

Wait, should I buy the Standard Pack? No. Fortune Teller is +11 Mult. If I use more Tarots, it scales. But I'm flush-heavy and Gros Michel is +15. If Michel breaks, Fortune Teller is a backup. Space is full. Reroll is the play.

Let's double-check the previous turn: Turn 94, shop info was the same. Did I not reroll yet? Yes, rerolling is logical now. I'm flush level 4, and straight level 2.

Is there any reason to go to round select? Saving money? But finding Jupiter or a better Joker is more valuable than $1 interest.

Okay, let's provide the JSON.

```json
{
  "action": "reroll_shop"

```

Wait, I need to make sure I cannot use "The Moon" now. I'm in the shop. I do not have poker cards in my hand (only in the select stage or in packs). So `use_consumable` won't work for a suit-converter.

Let's stick with reroll\_shop. I just remembered that Perkeo creates a Negative copy of a random consumable in possession *at the end of the shop*. I have two Moons. This is good.

"Space Joker" and "Fortune Teller" are available. Space Joker is okay if I have a free slot, but I don't. Reroll it is.

Wait, if I'm satisfied, the user might want me to just `round_select`. But the shop has 1 Standard Pack and 2 mediocre Jokers. Rerolling to look for a Planet (Jupiter) or a better Joker (since Gros Michel might break) is better.

I have 5/5 Jokers. To buy a new one, I'd have to sell one.

3. Droll (+10, x1.5, x1.5)

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
